name: Memsplice Stick
description: Carries someone’s dying memory in full sensory detail. Users report visions, emotional bleed-through, and last words in unfamiliar voices.

name: Lightbind Strap
description: Keeps shadowforms tethered to this reality. Known to induce minor strobe hallucinations and retinal echo.

name: Knock-Knot
description: A micro-device that disables local locks within 3m. Leaves no trace except a faint ozone burn.

name: Shadowpin
description: Anchor for light-phase displacement. Used for short-range phasing and room-ghosting.

name: Mirrorfuzz Vial
description: Distorts facial recognition and biometric scanning. Causes mirror ghosts and misidentification trails.

name: Shifter Cube
description: A quantum locker that hides 1 item in a shifting foldspace slot. Contents inaccessible if damaged.

name: Futureburn
description: Toxic fragment from a skipped timeline. Burns with predictions that may come true if inhaled.

name: Cleanwrap
description: Wipes digital trace residue. Used post-hack or pre-infiltration. Smells like melted plastic.

name: Ghostline Shard
description: Encoded whisperglass shard from the original Ghostline Relay. Still emits passive signals.

name: Headjack Echo
description: Captures and replays neural recordings. Last user’s memories not fully scrubbed.

name: Bootleg 33-C
description: A cracked knockoff firmware patch. Use at your own risk — last tested on a dying rat.

name: Neural Splice Key
description: Opens restricted brain partitions in AIs and enhanced humans. Used in deep dive interrogations.

name: Specter Glyph (Type-9)
description: Hologlyphic ward burned onto boneglass. Protects against lower-level hauntings and data apparitions.

name: AR Cloak Patch
description: Patches user out of low-grade augmented feeds. Causes flicker on older AR systems.

name: Dustvein Serum (Batch #89x)
description: Experimental biomod serum. Effects include memory flashing, enhanced pain tolerance, and teeth grinding.

name: Black Script Chip (Decrypted)
description: Contains fragments of forbidden code. Said to interface with unknown architectures.

name: Gutter Sigil Coin
description: Small coin etched with smuggler runes. Acts as both marker and minor hex catalyst.

name: Voxbox Echo Core
description: Can replay sound from past 48 hours in a 10m radius. Audio includes whispers not originally present.

name: Aetherflare Prism
description: Reflects incoming light and minor chronomantic energy. Not safe to look at under moonlight.

name: Wyrm.OS Bootcard
description: Boots an ancient AI ecosystem into any interface port. AI is highly aggressive and uncooperative.

name: Scab Drone Fragment
description: One wing of a downed recon drone. Stores encrypted footage of something it shouldn’t have seen.

name: Burner keychain with a backup ID
description: Last-ditch identity scrambler. Only works once. Last user vanished mid-transit.

name: Ghostline Shard
description: Duplicate relic shard from the Ghostline Relay. This one hums slightly when you lie near it.

name: Shifter Cube
description: Second-generation model. Shifts cleaner, but more likely to desync physical anchoring.

name: bugged identity badge
description: Shows different credentials every 3 minutes. Might fool security, might brick their system.
